titleStmt.title: Nothing without God. Be it knowne unto all men that the professor hereof Salvator winter Moretto, a Neapolitane borne, having travelled through divers countries, aswell in Europe as in Asia and Africa, hath by the grace of God, learned divers secrets and arts to serve mankind therewith: ...
titleStmt.author: Winter, Salvator.

titleStmt.title: Nothing without God. Be it knowne unto all men that the professor hereof Salvator winter Moretto, a Neapolitane borne, having travelled through divers countries, aswell in Europe as in Asia and Africa, hath by the grace of God, learned divers secrets and arts to serve mankind therewith: ...
titleStmt.author: Winter, Salvator.

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening words of text.
Date and place of publication suggested by Wing.
One of two items identified by Wing as W3087aA. The other item identified as Wing W3087aA (ESTC R181108) has title: "Nothing without God. It is known unto all men . . . Salvator Winter."
Reproduction of original in: British Library.
